description: Buy the MSR Evo Tails online or shop all Snowshoe from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Evo Tails
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Evo Tails online or shop all Snowshoe from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I bought these at the end of the snowshoe season and have NOT used them. Presumably these will work at least as fine as did their predecessors.
review.name: The Error of Asking your Customers for Reviews Before They Can Try Out the Equipment.

review.reviewBody: Haven‚Äôt used them this year. Atmospheric river keep us from the snow. Roads are impassable. Now the spring thaw is upon us. Maybe next year I‚Äôll get to try them out.ü§ûüèª
review.name: Haven‚Äôt used them this year.

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my son for Christmas. I bought old Denali shoes years ago and love them for blazing a trail through the woods for the dogs. The Tails are very helpful for flotation if it's a deep snow fall until we get the trail established. Good gear...
review.name: Snow Shoes

review.reviewBody: purchased out of season. have not been able to test more than fit which was great.
review.name: untested

review.reviewBody: They don't fit older models, having to do some grinding and bolting on to get them to work.
review.name: They don't fit older models,

review.reviewBody: Have not actually used them but did test for ease of assembly and found it to be simple. They appear to be of high quality. The only possible problem I can foresee will be with them staying attached as the nut that screws down to attach does not have any kind of locking mechanism which could lead to loosening and loss of a tail.
review.name: Hopeful

review.reviewBody: A little difficult to put on until you get the hang of it. Did add some floatation, but in 6-8"" of fresh snow and 220 lb load, they really didn't help appreciably. Worst problem is one kept coming off, until I eventually lost it. And you can't buy a single tail. I wish the design could be improved. I only recommend them if you really, really need that extra floatation, and you are willing to tighten them down so tight that they will be very hard to remove.
review.name: They come off too easily

review.reviewBody: These are relatively easy to put on and take off even with gloves on, and really boost the performance of the snowshoes if you are planning on going on an extended trip with some gear.
review.name: Good performance boost for heavier loads

review.reviewBody: I use my Evo snowshoes for doing laps on my snowboard. But some days the snow is deep, dry, and awesome. Deep snow makes the downhill super fun. But the uphill is a slog. These tails make it the slog so much easier. They attach extremely easy with just a twist of a knob. Instant flotation! Now I carry them in my backpack every trip up the mountain just in case I need them.
review.name: Great for those awesome powder days

review.reviewBody: I got these to help keep my snowshoes from sinking into deep fluffy snow. I only need them in fresh powder that's over a foot deep but they make quite a big difference. The MSR system is brilliant and allows you to decide whether you want the maneuverability of short shoes or the flotation of longer ones. Also keeps the cost of snowshoeing down and makes my adventures in the snow all the more enjoyable.
review.name: Great product, makes snowshoes much more versatile

name: Evo Tails

review.reviewBody: This hat is wet made.  The felt is uniformly smooth and the color pretty true to what backcountry shows on-line ( I bought the "driftwood" color).    The chin strap is a simple leather strip and is very stiff, and feels scratchy.   I plan to get a woven shoe string, as for hiking boots,  to replace it.   The chin strap easily unties, but leaves the two holes in the brim, of course.  The sizing is exactly right using the Stetson sizing chart.
review.name: Well made,  scratchy chin strap

review.reviewBody: This is my third hat from Stetson and a really love the quality. I used for hike or going to the town.
review.name: Stylish

review.reviewBody: The fit is perfect and I love the color! It's a perfect beige, exactly as pictured.
review.name: Beautiful!

review.reviewBody: Very cute hat, but the color pictured mushroom does not reflect the real color in person, definitely more liken the dark version. I still like the hat. The picture also shows more of a flat brim and it has the curve of a cowboy hat
review.name: Cute but not the correct color

name: Santa Fe Hat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was purchased on a clearance situation. Please be prepared.
review.name: Preparer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The body wash I bought works well and does its job as advertised, but I really don't care for the smell. It might be good to have a few options there.
review.name: Good stuff, smells weird.

review.reviewBody: I used the body wash, shampoo/conditioner, and laundry wash. I will say that the shampoo conditioner combo is not very effective as a conditioner. But I still use it at shampoo and just use a conditioner afterwards. (maybe better for short hair) I do think that the bottles are a good size, can be refilled if you pop out the little top thing, and do not leak.
review.name: Good size and does not leak!

review.reviewBody: I got this shaving cream recently and used it at home and was pleasantly surprised by how well it worked. It is well concentrated, meaning a little bit goes a long way. I've starting using this in place of my regular shaving cream (at home). I don't shave when I'm camping, so I haven't used it out of the house, but the fact that it's good enough to use at home says a lot (in my opinion).
review.name: Great Shaving Cream

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A great item, I am using it every day. It is lightweight and very versatile, it washed everything from clothes to campware to my body and hair. I will surely get more of the same range.
review.name: A great item, I am using it every day.

review.reviewBody: IFYI: I ususally shave with just waer and sometimes a bit of bio-soap in the backcountry. The Sea to Summit Shaving Cream is amazing! I waited unti I was on a bikepacking and trailing building trip to use it. The results were incredible. I brought it home and had my wife and daughter give it a try and they had the exact experience. I will be keeping this around and ordering more when I run out.
review.name: Really amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using the Sea to Summit shaving cream for several years now. It's not only a great size for travel, but is just as efficient for using at home. No more need to by any shaving cream!
review.name: Effective for travel as well as at home

review.reviewBody: Great product idea that really works. How many stupid-big cans of shaving cream have I packed into luggage in the past on ‚Äúfront country‚Äù trips? This will replace those. In the backcountry, I‚Äôve used classic concentrated bio soap brands, but this stuff works far better for shaving. I was genuinely surprised with how little I needed. A small bottle of this could serve a full group for a few weeks. Nice improvement in long term backcountry comfort.
review.name: Why Didn‚Äôt Someone Think of This Sooner?

review.reviewBody: Sturdy bottle, tight seal, light green tea scent for both. Love that they are 'leave no trace' and biodegradable. The shaving cream was easy to use and you don't need a lot for either to have them work well. The shampoo w conditioner was not drying as it can tend to be the case with combo cleaners. Very easy to travel with.
review.name: Shampoo with Conditioner and Shaving Cream

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wanted some quality travel soap for when I am hiking and camping. The little travel bottle works well. Highly recommend it for its convenience and quality.
review.name: Quality travel soap

name: Trek & Travel Liquid Soaps

review.reviewBody: So happy with the jacket.  I like the big hood, perfect color and great fit.   And it kept me nice and dry!!
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody:
I love this shell!! It does it all for me and goes on every adventure. This 3 layer Gore-Tex shell is   completely wind and waterproof while staying breathable. Not only is the shell itself breathable, it has huge pit zippers/vents. It weighs 17 oz, so will stand up to heavy snow and rain without weighing much. I wear this as my everyday rain jacket, ski shell, adventure shell and you name it shell. It has everything you need but only the minimum to save weight. 

Fit is true to size, slightly large but essentially true to size with room to layer winter layers underneath. My mild temp ski kit is Triolet shell with Capilene Thermal or Midweight under. Cold temp is Triolet shell, Capilene Thermal, with Down Sweater Vest or R2 Tech Face jacket. Really cold is Triolet shell, Capilene Thermal or Air and Down Sweater.
review.name: Does it all!

name: Triolet Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: These glasses are good - lightweight, nicely designed, and w good options for sun protection.  However, one of the side light guards is not snugly fitted enough in its little "pivot holes" and kept popping off when the glasses were taken off and put back on during a winter hike.  That piece will definitely get lost along the way!
review.name: good but maybe more style than substance....

review.reviewBody: Love em, great clarity and work great as this time of year the sun is low and in your eyes alot
review.name: Ferrara review

review.reviewBody: Awesome glasses, super dark and feel sturdy. My only problem is that the side shields pop off easily. Not while wearing them, just have to be careful folding them up.
review.name: Love Them

review.reviewBody: I have an XL head and these fit good and don't look small on me. Bronze lenses are crispy for overcast conditions and also work good in full sun
review.name: Good fit and tint

review.reviewBody: These are my new go to shades. I wear them everyday, mostly with the sunshields out, but I keep the nose piece on. These lenses are so crisp it really sets the mood when you put them on in the sunshine.
review.name: My new go to everyday shades

review.reviewBody: I have a pretty big head, and so it's always a struggle to find glacier shades that properly sit on my big noggin - and these do it perfectly.  They've even got a bit of an oversize look on me, which is super helpful in the backcountry where every inch of coverage counts.  And Sunski clearly has my eyes here - with the sun shields AND the clever middle piece, it could be raging force 9 outside, while my eyes are basically having a tea party in their safe cocoon
review.name: oversize & over the moon

review.reviewBody: Sunski has taken their alpine shades to the next level! These sunglasses are insanely comfortable and lightweight. The lens optics slap. The removable centerpiece and sun shields really do help block glare when you're out in the snow. Bonus: They look badass.
review.name: The GOAT of backcountry sunglasses

name: Ferrata Polarized Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I ordered two of these (Egret and Fossil) and the are a perfect fit, good quality material - slightly thicker and not see-through either.  Fits exactly as expected, exactly as seen on the model. Will be ordering in different colors for summer pops of color but also great as a layering piece.
review.name: Perfect Basic

review.reviewBody: I bought this tee in the Egret color and I am absolutely obsessed with it! Like above review I also thought this would be a little more white in color, but it is definitely more of a "cream" color. I still love it and the fit is PERFECT! It hits right at the hips, has a little dip in hem at the back and is just so flattering. I am absolutely ordering this top in allllllll the colors! The rib makes this top feel more expensive than it is and I would highly recommend for a more pulled together basic, while still feeling extremely comfortable.
review.name: Seriously Obsessed

review.reviewBody: I wanted white.  Totally my fault.  I simply looked at pic.  It says Egret. I know that is not exactly white.  Sick.  I wanted WHITE!   They are  TOTALLY beige !!!!!!!   Tops are okay.  Would recommend buying at Walmart.   Not here.
review.name: Sad

review.name: Would buy again

review.reviewBody: Really have loved this since I bought my first one years ago, so now I am getting another one. (In between bought one from a different brand, was no comparison, their material pilled up, and they had a very annoying center seam right across the nose and mouth, not the two side seams like the OR.) This thing is so versatile, due to it giving you just enough warmth, yet still being extremely lightweight and thus easy to fit in a pocket, purse, etc. I bought it for watching outdoor football games but last few years it is my go to on the bike trail. In weather from 30F-50F I wear it as a single layer to add just enough warmth, or keep it in my pocket "just in case." In weather from 0F-30F I wear it with a winter hat over the top, and/or a scarf around it, over the face hole. Either way it fits well under the helmet. I really can not do with out it, and was worried what I would do if something ever happened to my original. Thus, I am so happy to see I can get a 2nd one... thanks OR!!
review.name: One of best purchases I ever made!

review.reviewBody: I use this balaclava for commuting in the NE. It's the perfect weight for biking below ~25F. Fits under a helmet better than a beanie. One complaint; when worn over the nose, it squishes my nose pretty severely, making it difficult to breath.
review.name: Good for high exertion

review.reviewBody: Like other reviewers have mentioned, the L/XL fits a little tighter than what I think would be ideal. So far I have used it snowboarding under my L size helmet as a thin layer to hold all my hair in place and manage sweat without being too hot, and for that purpose it's great. After a while of wearing it with the helmet on I stopped noticing it being too tight, but at first it feels a little uncomfortable and I could see it being a problem for others with larger heads than mine
review.name: Good, but slighlty tight

review.reviewBody: Buyers beware... even the L/XL version of this is SNUG! I'm a 27 yr old female, 125lbs. Not exactly comfortable. I feel like I'm going scuba diving!
review.name: runs small!

review.reviewBody: My second one of these. Lost the first one at Yellowstone over the winter. Excellent choice for someone who sweats a ton.
review.name: Great head gear

review.reviewBody: I have a hot head, so this light weight balaclava is ideal. It fits great under my ski helmet, protects the back of my neck and is not to hot on my head. Ideal.
review.name: I would purchas this product again

review.reviewBody: An easy packing, easy to use under-helmet layer. The single round opening eventually shifts (always to my right for some reason) and has to be periodically re-positioned, which is slightly annoying. Other than that it's a good addition to my Alpine kit.
review.name: Good Under-Helmet Layer

review.reviewBody: I use this balaclava at work as a ski patroller. It is a great balaclava for cold stormy days. I intend to keep using it but wanted to give one piece of feedback: the back of the neck should be longer. There is often a gap between the balaclava and my jacket. I do not experience this problem when using something like a buff. A little more length would make this thing perfect.
review.name: great, could use one improvement

review.reviewBody: Great cold weather gear! Fits perfect
review.name: Great fit!

name: Option Balaclava

review.itemreviewed: Cabrio LV Free 130 3D Wrap Ski Boot - 2025
review.reviewBody:
If you have high insteps and skinny heels/legs, this boot might be for you. I find most overlap boots to be varying degrees of uncomfortable. My bootfitter picked these after seeing my feet. We proceeded to try on a bunch of overlap boots, which really highlighted how comfy these were in comparison. The liners are a bit stiff, but once molded, are incredible. I have 101/102 wide forefoot, but width was not an issue in these 99 last width boots. 
I am not a huge fan of the walk mechanism design as it is harder to engage/disengage than other manufacturers. It is simple, but I could see icing being an issue‚Ä¶we‚Äôll see. The buckle loops are made of very thin metal so I am slightly concerned about bending them and fatigue failures, but again..we‚Äôll see.
review.name: Solid crossover boot

name: Cabrio LV Free 130 3D Wrap Ski Boot - 2025

review.reviewBody: Nice jacket. Just wish the hood was adjustable like they used to be. (On top, not in front )

Fantastic coat! Color is a perfect match to the photo. Fit is comfortable and lightweight Keeps rain out perfectly and great wind resistance. Finish for all the zippers, velcro, branding feels very premium. Lightweight for an easy pack
review.name: I love my new coat!!!

review.reviewBody: Perfect light weight rain jacket. Great for layering. Bought for my college student- loves it!
review.name: Perfect light weight rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Haven't worn it in the rain yet. Seems lole it build well.
review.name: Rain rain go away

review.reviewBody: Glad I brought it on a trip with me to Taiwan where a major tropical storm in the Philippines has brought non-stop rain. This kept me dry in the torso. The hood also kept me dry, but when I had finally returned to my hotel, I could feel dampness in the inside of my hood. I didn't notice because I typically wear a hat out for sun and or weather protection. All-in-all, this is a solid layer that isn't exceptionally warm, but good enough to block mild wind and will stay dry. I wasn't in pouring rain, so I can't speak to that.
review.name: Solid light rain layer, but don't expect too much!

review.reviewBody: After spending a couple of weeks searching for a quality rain jacket. After reading over 30 reviews, I am so glad I landed on the Men's Alta Vista Jacket. Not only is it high quality at a reasonable price, I am in love with the Beetroot (red) color. It really looks great and goes with almost everything. 10/10 recommend!
review.name: The Must Have Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: My high school freshman grandson wears this jacket in our rainy Alaskan climate. Fit is fine, lines are good, a classic.
review.name: An affordable classic

review.reviewBody: Checks all the necessary boxes for me... nice cut, chest pocket, pit zips, and compact. Love it.
review.name: Perfect rain jkt

review.reviewBody: This is the first The North Face jacket I've owned and I'm extremely satisfied with my purchase. It's warm, but not too warm for windy 45-degree weather. It keeps rain out really well, and I love the way it looks too! I bought a medium (my usual size) and my only quibble is that the sleeves are a little longer than ideal for me. I'm actually hoping for more cold damp weather so I can wear it more!
review.name: Both stylish AND comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Great when walking the dog and attending foorball games in the red ... the color is similar to my school colors
review.name: would buy again and again

review.itemreviewed: RBX Adventure SWAT Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I am 6', ~170lbs, and measure between sizes, so I purchased sizes medium and large (I wear medium in other "premium" brands). The size medium fit more snug than other brands, though the straps were incredibly uncomfortable. There doesn't seem to be much, if any, stretch in the straps which actually made it challenging to get into. The size large seemed to fit pretty well at first. The straps are still noticeably tight/unforgiving, though, with an base layer, not a deal breaker. Unfortunately, after a couple short rides I've noticed the legs bunching a bit, causing chafing, likely due to sizing up. Otherwise, the material and chamois are high quality and the pockets are super handy.
review.name: Poor fit, Uncomfortable

review.itemreviewed: RBX Adventure SWAT Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wear size large in most bibs and this one is good on all respect except the straps are a bit tight.  At 5'9" I'm not out of the realm of a large in the torso.  I've owned a couple of Specialized swat bibs in the past, this one is the best but the tight straps seems to be a common problem amongst all I've had.
review.name: Good chamios, Swat is always excellent

review.itemreviewed: RBX Adventure SWAT Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Ive put about 40hours of riding in them and they work. The leg pockets are brilliant for a phone, snacks, or snack wrappers. The chamois is comfortable even after 6+hr rides. The elasticity is still snug and shows no sign of wear.
My only complaint is the front is a little too high and you really have to bend over to pee. I also get some rubbing in the front of my crotch and have to constantly adjust.
review.name: So far so good

name: RBX Adventure SWAT Bib Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: These shoes are really comfortable HOWEVER‚Ä¶pay attention to the fact that they are trail shoes. I got these for indoor use to wear at work and it sounds like you are walking in cleats. My coworkers always knew who was coming down the hallway!

review.itemreviewed: Fresh Foam X Trail More v3 Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: Makes my bike feel like a rocket ship that can still handle a corner. The amount of grip for the lack of rolling resistance is pretty impressive. I've had it out on several rides and I'm almost ashamed of the fact that this tire still looks nearly brand new, so it seems like it'll last a while as well.
review.name: Fast and grippy

review.reviewBody: I put a set of these tires on my YT Izzo, I think they are a good XC tire, light weight, fast rolling and they look nice with the grey side walls. I run them tubeless without any problems, I did notice on occasion they can wash out in hard cornering if you have the pressure too high, 15 to 18 psi seems to be the sweet spot for me. They now have over 200 miles on them and show very little wear.
review.name: Love these tires

review.reviewBody: I am running a Barzo in the front, and a Mezcal in the back.  I love the gray sidewalls, and the grip is very good (for an xc/trail tire).  There is good rolling resistance, and the tread pattern is great for my riding.  (I live near SLC, and ride primarily in that area.)  When I converted them to tubeless, they went on super easy.  I put a little sealant around the valve stems, and then blew them up.  My air compressor wasn't working, so I just used a floor pump, and the blew up and sealed.  Haven't had any problems with air or sealant leak, which is not normal for me.  These are now my favorite Xc/Trail tire combo.  Would recommend.
review.name: Great Tire

review.reviewBody: Been on Cross Kings for about 6 years. Decided to try these since the Cross Kings are hard to find right now and these have a very similar tread. I like to run wider tires on my 29er and I ordered the 2.35 version of these, and mounted up on a 35mm internal width rim they measure 2.3". Cross Kings in the 2.3 size on the same rims actually measure 2.4". Weight difference is less than 5 grams between the two on my scale. Contis have a burlier sidewall, which is really important on a wider tire like this where you'll be running lower air pressure. About the only thing I like better about the Barzo is that they mount up easier than the Conti, but I'm happy to deal with a little off-the-bike downside for 100% on-the-bike upside with the Cross Kings. I'll wear these out while I wait for Cross Kings to become available again.
review.name: Conti CrossKings are better in every way
comment: I haven't used Cross Kings, but I do agree that the sidewall on the Barzo is not as burly as I like my tires to be. I'm 195 pounds.

review.reviewBody: I love the grip and cornering
review.name: Great tires

name: Barzo G2.0 4C XC Trail 29in Tire

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for the windy/Rainy weather in the Pacific Northwest and I‚Äôm very pleased with how it delivered. Warmth isn‚Äôt a strong suit of the jacket, but I think that‚Äôs not something you‚Äôre after if you‚Äôre looking at this. Very happy to have this in my wardrobe for hopefully years to come
review.name: Great rainy/windy weather gear

review.reviewBody: Excellent jacket for rainy days in the UK. Fits well, pockets well placed and designed. Glad I bought it
review.name: Great rain jacket

review.reviewBody: Great fit and function, sufficiently waterproof and better breathing than gore tex.
review.name: Breathes better than gore tex

review.reviewBody:
Like the jacket and the features, but as other reviewers have noted; the fit is weird. Its too narrow in the shoulders and too wide in the torso, plus the sleeves are too long. I'm 72kg and 6ft, the medium is too wide and drafty in the torso and the small is too tight in the shoulders. Sleeves are too long on both sizes.

Wish Fjallraven would update their fits across lots of their jackets.
review.name: Good jacket but odd fit

review.reviewBody: This is a nicely made jacket and feels well made. Be aware though that it is not in any way waterproof and is only shower proof until it wets out. This is not a serious jacket to take into the hills but more of a fashion jacket. The fit is also very strange, it comes up small around the torso but way too long on the arms. I am a standard medium build but needed to buy a large to fit me on the torso and the sleeves are way too long, I really don't understand the fit on this jacket.
review.name: Good jacket but strange fit

review.reviewBody:
Not really impressed with quality. Fit is not quite right. Sleeves are too long. I'm 5'9 with average length arms, and the sleeves cover half of my hands with the medium. If I had gotten small the jacket would have been too tight in the chest because the medium fits closely around my torso.

 I have the Expedition Pack Down in medium and the fit on that is perfect and feels very high quality. Not sure why this jacket is so much looser, and it seems to be a step down in quality for sure. Also, the zipper gets stuck easily and feels cheap. I would not buy this jacket again.
review.name: Okay, not great.

review.reviewBody:
I‚Äôve been using this jacket for the past 8 months and it‚Äôs been
extremely reliable in a variety of different conditions.
Walking in sub zero temps, I found I was constantly undoing
or taking off layers when using an insulated jacket,
becoming sweaty and uncomfortable, but winter walking in the Skogsko
I found it to be breathable and pleasant keeping me
at a constant temperature. Once you stop, throwing
on an insulated layer or hard shell will take care of the¬†
cooling down issue.
Because of the fit (medium) and it‚Äôs stylish cut, you¬†
get only compliments when out and about, but the quality¬†
if it‚Äôs manufacture and rock solid construction means it‚Äôs¬†
practically bulletproof and can be used in all sorts of¬†
work/outdoor scenarios. I‚Äôve been using it more and¬†
more on the farm and for forestry work, as you can brush¬†
up and rub against tough bark or metal fencing or briars
without so much as a scratch on the material, especially¬†
if it‚Äôs been waxed a couple of times, and once¬†
it‚Äôs waxed it becomes very tough and durable
¬†with a patina‚Äôd look which adds to its appeal.

Worn under my Hoggs waterproof, this jacket becomes¬†
a completely wind proof, waterproof system- it can be blowing
60 mph and you just will not feel a thing- absolutely no
warmth escaping from anywhere.¬†

I must mention that the construction, build, stitching
and overall quality seems to be superior to the insulated¬†
version of this jacket, so I‚Äôd recommend buying a size¬†
larger and layering accordingly for winter, as this jacket¬†
just gets better with age.¬†
Out of all my outdoor clothing purchases in the last 
two years this has been my favourite, 
most useful, and will continue¬†
to provide reliable functionality for years to come.
review.name: Exceptional quality, timeless style

review.reviewBody: Happy with it for an outter shell with a Melanzana as my midnweight and a synthetic t-shirt.
review.name: Solid for 11k ft winters

review.reviewBody:
XXXL DID NOT FIT.  Yes it is a 4 star review of a product that I cannot wear and have returned.  I am 6'4" (193 cm) and 
245 lbs (111 Kg) with a bit of a pot belly.  I really wanted this jacket to fit, but it was too tight in the belly, and I could not
sit or bend over without my belly stretching the jacket.  I have other Fjallraven products, A Nuuk parka, in XXXL that fits
perfectly, but the Skogso was too tight in the belly.  It fit perfectly in the shoulder, neck and sleeves.  

So, sorry chubby people this is not the jacket for you.  Maybe in the future Fjallraven will go the same route 
as other clothing manufacturers and offer extended sizes for big, but active people.  Other than that great clothes(when they fit)
review.name: Great jacket, DID NOT FIT

review.reviewBody: Great looking jacket but maybe 1000 stands for how waterproof - it‚Äôs not waterproof at all! Caught in a shower and rain went right through. You‚Äôll need to wax it yourself, quite extraordinary for an outdoor jacket. Wish me luck with the waxing!
review.name: Waterproof?

name: Skogso Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Perfect bag for travel. The wheels sre smooth. The carrying handles are in the right spots for handling.


 You will need additional padding since the built in padding to separate the board are minimal. This non issue since I place all my board in its individual bag for added protection and it fits perfectly.
review.name: Everything I need

review.reviewBody: I really liked everything about this bag, thick padded protection on the outside, wheels for pulling the bag, pocket, straps...evreything EXCEPT that it only had VERY thin protectors for in between the boards inside.  Not only are they very thin but they do not go the length of the bag, maybe only a couple feet.  Great that you can carry up to 4 boards, but terrible internal protection between those boards.  I was real bummed so I returned it.
review.name: Real nice but...

review.reviewBody: Wide cut and ergonomically shaped soles live up to what you expect from Oboz footwear. So comfy! I normally wear a 6.5 and the 7 fits fine for after a run.
review.name: Comfy after-run footwear

review.reviewBody: I planned to wear these as slippers after back surgery since the brand has excellent insoles and is lightweight; however, I used these as slip-on PT/walking shoes.  I found these to run much larger/wider than all my other regular Oboz sizing (I am usually a 9.5  or 10 and ordered a 10). Consider ordering a size down if you are a half-size.
review.name: Great slip on walking shoe

review.reviewBody: When I first put these on and walked they felt kind of weird .That quickly faded to pure bliss. These are the best slippers I have ever put my feet into.  My feet are always freezing. My house is on a cement slab. No  flooring what so ever.  My feet are now warm and cozy.   If you have never worn the Oboz brand,  they are EXTREMELY comfortable, well made with a fantastic arch support.. I have been wearing the shoe for a couple of winters now and I am now purchasing my second pair of their slippers in a different color.  I strongly urge you to buy this slipper- You will forever thankful you did!
review.name: BEST of CLASS!

name: Whakata Puffy Slipper - Women's

review.reviewBody: I received these as a Xmas gift and have not taken them off. Too bad they sent me the wrong color, two sizes too big. We ordered the patchwork in M but got the cactus in XL. I was so excited to put them on that I didn‚Äôt look at the size and forgot what pattern I wanted. ¬Ø\_(„ÉÑ)_/¬Ø  They‚Äôre huge on me but sooooo comfy.
review.name: Soooo comfy

review.reviewBody: I got these for Western New York winters and they‚Äôre helping to keep me warm for sure. They‚Äôre soft, comfortable, cute, warm. Downside they don‚Äôt stand up to the cold wind as it goes right through the material. And I would absolutely size down. I like really baggy but these were a bit too baggy I just didn‚Äôt want to deal with exchanging them.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody:
I am 5'4", a curvy 144 lbs, purchased the Medium. They are kind of baggy but that's what I was going for. I wanted something comfy and on the larger side. I live in Michigan and this is going to be my go to for sure!! Perfect for under my snow suit. I might get this in the other color, black and white. They are so fluffy but a tad on the shorter side but that works for me.
If you want something more on the form fitting side, I would say size down.
review.name: LOVE THEM!!

review.reviewBody: These bibs are so darn warm and comfortable. Would love a solid color for more versatile outfits, but the cactus design is super cute and fun!
review.name: More please

review.reviewBody: I just purchased these for this winter, and I'm so pleased with them. I'm very cold natured, and I'm always looking for something cute, comfy and warm. These are so adorable and truly comfortable! Like the other reviewer mentioned, I wish they came in more solid colors, but I know for a fact that I'm going to enjoy these. I would definitely purchase another one if they had some different colors/designs.
review.name: In Love!

review.reviewBody: This is the most comfortable thing you can possibly wear and it‚Äôs extremely warm and it feels like wearing a blanket. I absolutely loved to walk my dog in it or go to the mountains for a hike in it. I love it so much. I bought one for my daughter and my daughter-in-law to be! I will admit I wish it came in some solid colors and some more basic designs but I still love it.
review.name: Like wearing a warm blanket

name: Burrdee Fleece Overall - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I recently finished the Manaslu Circuit in Nepal and my Salomon boots were my best friend and most trusted companion. I have foot arthritis and plantar fasciitis, but during the trek I had no issues. My Salomon boots felt very comfortable the entire time trekking the Himalayas, and now that I'm back they are the only shoes I wear. They look and feel great. I LOVE them! I trust Salomon so much I just order another pair of trail shoes so I have another shoe option. Thank you, Salomon!
review.name: trekked the Himalayas with Salomon

review.itemreviewed: Cross Hike 2 Mid GTX Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This shoe is an excellent hiking boot! It is light weight, provides excellent ankle support, great traction, well padded, and protects feet from rocks.  Highly recommend it for day hikes!

review.reviewBody: not the best quality
review.name: there are better options out there

review.reviewBody:
Perfect!  So easy to set up, a little heavy but for me it works!  So much better than the one person tent
I have room for my backpack and hey if Bigfoot wants to get out of the cold plenty of room for us both! ü•≥üòÅ
review.name: Great tent

review.reviewBody: I loved this tent on my trip to Havasupai this summer. Lightweight but not too small. My only complaint is the door setup with the rainfly on an angle. I understand why it's designed that way, but it makes getting in and out of of the tent somewhat difficult/clumsy.
review.name: Great tent for adventuring

review.reviewBody: Amazing tent, super simple to set up and reasonably light. For the price of this tent, I don‚Äôt think you can get a better one. You can easily fit a twin sized air mattress for car camping or two people on small pads for backpacking. Took it bike packing on my dirtbike multiple times and it fit well on the outside of my saddlebags and I had plenty of room to sleep comfortably.
I use as a single-man/adult tent. Light enough for backpacking, but not ultralight. Easy setup. Good durability.
A really great little light weight tent for 1-2 humans. Really great for hot summer nights if canoe or short-distance hiking. Car camping of course, but maybe a bit heavy for a longer multi-day hike.
review.name: Perfect lil' tent

review.reviewBody: Kept me dry in a torrential downpour on the first weekend I took it out!  Easy to set up.
review.name: Midori 2person

review.reviewBody: I bought this tent 3yrs ago now, during the last trip of the season last year I noticed the mesh on the sealing ripped near the seam. I really loved the tent and how easy it was to set up. I'm a little disappointed as this is my first "entry level premium tent" and expected a little more durability and longevity out of it.
review.name: Awesome tent but fragile mesh
comment: Thank you for taking the time to leave your review.  We would like the opportunity to speak with you to assist you further on your concern. Please contact us at your convenience, 1-800-572-8822 8am-5pm EST Monday-Friday. We will be happy to look into this.

review.reviewBody: I just got back from 2 weeks in Panama camping with the Midori 2's (we had 4).  I'm fairly certain it's the best warm weather tent available today.  Its full mesh tent design is perfect for hot buggy places.  I was a great fan of the Spitfire 2 and this is better - roomier, easier to put up and I think sturdier.   The fly works well if it does rain.  My only recommendation would be to make it easier to "roll up" the fly so you can keep it out of the way unless a tropical storm does roll through.  It's a lot of tent for the money and if you are going somewhere hot - the best.
review.name: Midori review

review.reviewBody:
I love this little tent. The full mesh body makes it feel larger inside than it really is because the walls are not closing in on you. 

The yellow is bright, so it is easy to spot if you wander a little far from camp (the green is a bit softer than the picture, not a bright kelly green).

I was surprised when I set it up because the end by the feet is smaller than the end by the head. I am all about cutting unnecessary weight, so I don't mind, but I said the size runs small because of this. It also creates a unique shape overall because the overhead bar is not set directly in the center like most tents. Even so, we did not notice once we were inside. We fit two people without feeling crowded and still had room at our feet to put some stuff.

The tent is very easy to set up, but you do have to line it up correctly since the size changes from one end to the other. The poles and hooking straps are color-coded, so this is not a problem.

I haven't taken this out on a full backpacking trip yet, but using it in the campground has worked very well. The seams are sealed well and we didn't have any issues with rain. Eureka has also worked great for us in the past!
review.name: Great tent

name: Midori 2 Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

review.reviewBody: Great shirts! I‚Äôve several of these shirts and they‚Äôre great for all outdoor activities when you‚Äôll be exposed to the sun. I wear mine fishing, ball games anytime that the sun is out.
review.name: Multi use shirt

review.reviewBody: I have a couple other sun hoodies. I appreciate this one has more manageable cuffs and hood. I appreciate the thumb and finger loops in the cuffs, they are snug enough you can pull them up a little and they stay put. Similar with the hood, the extra button and general cut keep the hood more in check if it is not on your head. Color is well represented by the images online.
review.name: Great option

review.reviewBody: Cool new colors, the shirt is comfortable and cool. It also dries quick.
review.name: M's Solar Flex rating

review.reviewBody: It's awesome! Great look, great fit, and very sharp!
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: It's rare that a garment checks all the boxes.  I'm 6'4" tall and weigh 215 lbs.  I bought an XL and it fit perfectly. The hood with the snap at the collar was a nice touch for the added warmth when needed.  The cut of the hood allows for excellent side vision.  The loop at the middle finger that adds back of the hand protection is another nice touch.  But the icing on the cake was the new garment treatment that basically elements odors.  I wore the garment for 3 days straight and it still smelled fresh. Well done Simms!
review.name: Outstanding garment

review.reviewBody: Love these shirts.  It's amazing how comfortable they are - the hoodie is cool in the summer and warm in the winter.  I highly recommend these shirts.
review.name: Highly Recommended!

review.reviewBody: The shirt is perfect. The area where the button is may be a little too bunched up.

review.reviewBody: The baselayer top is so thin that you can see through it when putting it on. It lets so much air through that it's barely worth wearing. It is not at all a mid-weight baselayer. I would not recommend this top any kind of cold weather. Slightly chilly weather maybe.
review.name: Not As Advertised

review.reviewBody:
Patagonia?s Capilene line is undeniably the best base layer in the game, Thermal, Mid and Air series. These mid weight are my favorite, including the bottom piece. 

I use it as part of a layering system. I stay cool and dry when I?m out being active but warm when I?m static. I rotate between three sets for the better part of fall and all of winter while adding or shedding layers when needed. These are nicely priced as well. 

I have had mine for two seasons and they still smell great. I used Nike?s dri-fit before and after one year, it smelled awful.
review.name: Simply Unbeatable

name: Capilene Midweight Zip-Neck Top - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Spring Fall C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got these to pair with leg warmers when it's too cold for summer bibshorts and too warm for bib tights.  Normally I go to warmers when it's below 55F.  But on a chilly mid '60's day I figured I had these, why not wear them instead of summer shorts?  The added warmth from the fleece lining was REALLY welcome.  Before this comfort fit Mille version came out, I used the RS version as those were the only Spring/Fall bibshorts ASSOS offered.  I no longer have a skinny racer body so the Mille fit works much better for me.
review.name: Handy warmth, very comfy

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTS Spring Fall C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I love Assos gear and have multiple Assos bibs.  I bought these for riding in the 40‚Äôs when it‚Äôs too cold for regular bibs but not cold enough for 3/4 or full length. My only complaint is that the inseam could be longer to give better coverage on cold rides.  Otherwise the fit is true.   They are more of a summer length on me, so I find myself reaching for other bibs instead.
review.name: Comfortable cold weather bibs.

name: Mille GTS Spring Fall C2 Bib Short - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Specialized Tactic 4 Mips Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Bought the Tactic 4 for trail and light enduro riding and it has not let me down! Granted, I have not crashed with it yet but it has the third-best crash rating by the Virginia Institute of Technology. It fits true to size with good airflow, rear head protection, and comfort. The only downside is the fact that the visor is nonadjustable so you will get smacked in the eyes with sunlight unless you wear goggles or sunglasses. Otherwise, the Tactic 4 is a 10/10 MTB helmet.
review.name: Excellent fit and very comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I returned is since the visor is way too high to be of any use whatsoever and is not adjustable. Poor design.
review.name: Feels and Look Good but Visor is Useless

review.reviewBody: Fits well, looks nice, quality seems high level, but I have no idea why they put the visor so high up on the helmet. It does not afford any eye shade except at high noon or thereabouts. And, it's not adjustable.
review.name: Great but visor is too high

review.reviewBody: This helmet was very highly ratecby the folks at Virgina Tech helmet evaluation facility. Good choice for good protection.
review.name: Great helmet at a great price.

review.reviewBody: It fits as it should with adjustments. Feels very secure and you have the peace of mind of the highest VT crash rating.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: I admit I had some concerns before purchasing due to mixed reviews on the heels. I'm here to say they are wrong! I have done multiple runs now in them and they are amazing. They are light as a feather. They are fast. You can feel yourself spring forward during a run. You are running on clouds! They are my new race shoe. I will be wearing them as I toe the start line of the Chicago Marathon next week. Let's go!
review.name: A perfect shoe

review.reviewBody: Absolutely loved this shoe, for a mile. Then I had razor blades digging into my heals. I always use a heal lock when I lace and no amount of loosening, adjusting, tightening, praying, wound help. I ended up pulling my orthotics out so my foot would sit lower in the shoe and walked.
review.name: Guess I should've read the reviews

review.reviewBody: Loving these! Awesome aesthetic design and cushy. Really enjoy walking on air. Many Thanks
review.name: Favorite Tennis's

review.reviewBody: I simply love the way these feel for training- light and fast, BUT... both heels dig into my feet to the point where I had blisters. They fit fine- after years of wearing Hoka, I know these are the right size. Looking at other reviews, I see this is a flaw of this model.. hope they fix it, because otherwise they are a great speedy trainer.
review.name: Great shoe but digs into heels

review.reviewBody: I'm in my feet all day long at work. They're just amazing.
review.name: I I will buy them again

review.reviewBody: I wanted to love this shoe. However, the lack of cushion/construction of the ankle collar shredded my heals and I had two blisters within a mile.
review.name: ankle collar = blisters

review.reviewBody: I wear a 7.5 in my Hokas, but these were way too small. If you're planning to order these, definitely size up by .5. I ended up returning instead of exchanging after reading some of the other reviews on blisters.
review.name: Too Small

review.reviewBody: TLDR: If you are a fan of the original Mach X, do your research before considering the switch to the X2's. I've gone through three pairs of Mach X's and absolutely loved everything about the fit, feel and overall performance. I was due for my fourth pair and Hoka had just released the X2's. I did my research and while I wasn't totally sold from what I had read I decided to give them a try in the hopes that these would be the new and improved version of the original X's. I've put around 200 road miles on these sneakers in the last 4 weeks and safe to say I am disappointed with these. As with many of the other reviews, the new heal design is flimsy and a pain to get into. Then once they are on, I've found my heal moving around inside the shoe. While the heal feels loose, the rest of the shoe feels too snug and narrow. I've always been a 9 in Hoka but wish I had sized up with these. Aside from this, I have been experiencing all kinds of post-run foot, leg and hip pain as well as significantly tougher recoveries. Tons of foot cramping in my arch and hip pain throughout the day after my longer runs. The only change i've made to my routine was these sneakers. I'll most likely revert back to the original Mach X since that was tried and true for me.
review.name: Not the Mach X level up I had hoped for

review.reviewBody: The Mach X2 is truly amazing- my first fast run I went 7:30 pace instead of my usual speed run pace of 8. They are super propulsive- feel like I'm being pushed by the shoe! I'm a senior runner and am always looking for a way to recapture the speed of a few years back. I bought these for speed workouts and longer races . They are not unstable- I need pronation support and the heel is no issue for me -comfortable and no rubbing. I would feel either of these issues- they are not there! I Strongly recommend these as a speed shoe!!!
review.name: Love this shoe! So fast

review.reviewBody: I had high hopes but they were crushed within minutes. I was expecting baby Cielo x1. The heel is AWFUL. It rubbed horrible. Not even a runners tie helped. Returning them before I get the blister the was forming.
review.name: High hopes crushed

name: Mach X 2 Running Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Overall, the Rab Cubix Down Hoody is an exceptional piece of outdoor clothing that provides superior warmth, protection, and style. If you're looking for a high-quality jacket that can handle anything the outdoors throws your way , I have saved money on my heating bill because of it and stylish which some out door clothing can be lacking in.

review.itemreviewed: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Warm, fits well, including the hood. Waterproofing effective.
review.name: Rab Cubit

review.itemreviewed: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a nice jacket.  The warmth to weight ratio is decent, considering the stretchy, durable material, and it's fairly comfortable.  The fit didn't work for me--too tight under the arms--but that's a common problem for me, and I may be a bit of an outlier in terms of back/shoulder shape.  Also, for me, the jacket had a bit too much space in the mid-section, which affected thermal efficiency.  And since the underarms were tight, I couldn't layer to fill in the space.  I'm 5'6" and weigh about 148 lbs, but mediums are often a bit small in the shoulders for me, this jacket might work well for many people.
review.name: Good if it fits

review.itemreviewed: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very well fitted jacked. Incredibly warm for early morning winter starts!
review.name: Cubit Stretch

review.itemreviewed: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great style and quality as usual. My only niggle is the hood. Hoody jackets generally feature basic hoods with little or no adjustment. This means that the size of the hood is critical. Some manufacturers go for a tighter fit - the patagonia micro puff is far too tight in my view. the Arcteryx hoodies go for a much looser fit with a cord to tighten at the back of the head as do some of the mountain equipment hoodies. This jacket is a looser fit with no adjustment and without a beanie on your head will turn inside it as you look from side to side. I have a large hat size and short hair, and find this is happening. possibly a baseball cap peak would help to stop this. I think Rab should pay attention to this as much as they have paid attention to the styling. For the price of the jacket it should be a little better in this regard.
review.name: Great quality, almost 100%

name: Cubit Stretch Down Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a great 50L cooler. No leaks after having ice melt and sit in the cooler for a couple days. The snaps in the handle strap are pretty much worthless as one of them broke when unpacking the cooler when it arrived. Thankfully there is velcro, as well as the snaps, that allows you to strap the carry handles together. Nice height as it fits under the luggage cover in our vehicles. Keeps things cold/cool for the day. If you need to keep things cold for longer look for something burlier. Great for day trips.
review.name: No Leaks, Solid Performance

review.reviewBody: the shoe is stiffer than the last version. toe box feels narrower. i think the added layer between the rubber and the eva foam is to blame. the idea of a resole on a sneaker is silly once the padding is shot the shoe is done. i have had 5 pairs of the old version and the rubber has outlasted the eva every time
review.name: stiffer and tighter

review.reviewBody: Great shoes for hiking in the mountains and climbing. The shoes provide good grip on steep slopes and rocks.
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: I've had 6 consecutive pairs of the now-discontinued La Sportiva TX4. I have a wide foot, and these have been a fantastic do-it-all, everyday shoe for me. This new "EVO" model is visibly shorter in length, and much narrower. I wore it for 6 hours, and eventually opted to end the day without shoes in a setting where that isn't totally appropriate. The shoe is probably great for someone; as they seem tough. But, be warned if you loved the old TX4 - this shoe fits a lot different.
review.name: WARNING: Smaller than the old TX4

review.reviewBody: I bought the shoes for hiking in Zion National Park (specifically Angel‚Äôs Landing) and I found them to be very comfortable with good, reassuring grip during Angel‚Äôs Landing and several other hikes that day.  There was a lot of elevation change and precarious trail involved in the hikes and the shoes handled it all with comfort and ease, no hot spots or blisters after a great day of hiking in Zion.
review.name: Hiking in Zion National Park

review.reviewBody: This shoe fits like a TX4; but the sole is as stiff as a hiking boot, takes more time to break in.
review.name: Approach or hiker?

name: TX4 Evo Approach Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
The colors on this jacket are beautiful, and the fit is perfect. I'm a tall (5'9") woman with an inverted triangle (broad shoulders, then rectangular) body type, very long arms, and a short torso. The arm length is great on me, the waist isn't comically long, and the jacket is plenty roomy to accommodate layers underneath. 

This is my second Cotapaxi jacket and the cut of their women's jackets fits me so much better than any other brand on the market that I just ordered a third. Because the fit is different than many other women's outdoor brands, I wouldn't recommend to everyone, but if you have an athletic build and/or prefer a less "feminine" cut, I can't recommend their gear highly enough!
review.name: Cielo Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: Comfortable, boxy-fit jacket is good length on the torso. Fabric/Material isn't stiff. Sleeves are too long for me-as a petite. But velcro closure helps hold sleeve on wrist.
review.name: Cielo Rain Jacket

review.reviewBody: The jacket has nice colors and feels really comfortable! When I wear this jacket, I‚Äôm protected from the rain and stay dry the whole time.
review.name: Cielo Rain Jacket - Women‚Äôs

review.reviewBody: Love the color and the fit. Does well in light to medium rain. But some leakage in a downpour we had the other day.
review.name: Did not keep me fully dry in a downpour.

review.reviewBody: While rain gear needs to function, I do prefer a bit of style to them and the colour block on this jacket is perfect for that. Hood is a good size.
review.name: Stylish & practical

review.reviewBody: I bought this as a gift and when my partner opened it her eyes lit up. The color, the fit and the quality made this a successful gift.
review.name: Love on my partner Cotopaxi

review.reviewBody: Love this rain jacket for how easy it is to carry in my backpack and then pull it out anytime it starts raining. Also love the big pockets and bright colors!
review.name: Easy to throw on!

review.reviewBody: It‚Äôs a bit thicker than previous rain jackets, which has been great. I don‚Äôt worry about rain eventually getting through. The colors are fun and more interesting than other rain jackets I‚Äôve come across. The sizing is just right and I‚Äôve recommended it to several people already.
review.name: Love it so far!

review.reviewBody: I love my Cotopaxi raincoat. I love the color, the quality, the sustainability, and the ethically sourced materials. Cotopaxi is not just a brand someone wears, it‚Äôs a lifestyle choice and a message to your peers to Do Good to other people and the environment. Best jacket out there!
review.name: BEST RAINCOAT EVER!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect fit. I bought it to wear in the jungle of Panama on a mission trip. I was rained on almost everyday and the jacket was a lifesaver.
review.name: Cielo Rain Jacket

name: Cielo Rain Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great harness & love all the adjustable straps. Love the breathable material on the inside of the waist & legs!!! It‚Äôs not as comfortable when coming down (it can dig into the back of your thighs.) I also am not a fan of the light color for outdoor climbing. It gets dirty REALLY fast! This to me is more of an indoor climbing harness.
review.name: Great Harness! But could be better.

review.reviewBody: Picked up climbing for the first time this year. Love the colors and fits very nicely, 5‚Äô2‚Äù 135lbs, fit my legs and waist nicely. Cushions make falling comfortable as well.
review.name: Great First Harness

review.reviewBody: This harness fits nice and snug around the waist while still accommodating females with bigger muscular legs. It's comfy, offers plenty of places to clip gear, and my personal favorite touch, the attention to detail with the stitches allowing you to know when the harness is worn and needs to be replaced. Great for beginners or experts. I've used it both inside and outside for climbs.
review.name: Great harness!

review.reviewBody:
I‚Äôve used this harness a few times now and I do really like it. It‚Äôs fairly comfortable, I love the way it looks, and it has plenty of gear loops for my needs. I‚Äôve gotten a lot of compliments on it at the gym. For reference, I got a size large and am a woman, 5‚Äô7, 200 lbs, 34 in waist, 44 in hips, and 28 in thighs. I have a lot of space to give more room if needed so it could accommodate someone with larger measurements as well. 

My only cons are that the leg straps don‚Äôt have a hard part in the cushion section so I can feel the strap inside when I sit back almost as if there‚Äôs no cushion at all. I will say though that I‚Äôve gotten used to it very quickly and hardly notice it now. It was just a bit uncomfortable my very first use because the one I was using before wasn‚Äôt like that. My other con is that the waist band has a cushion that you have to tuck into a loop on the other side as you‚Äôre tightening it. I‚Äôve had a few times where I thought I got it tight enough but then as I was descending there was a fist sized gap in the waist band. I do think it‚Äôs because of that cushion piece that it feels tighter than it actually is. But that again is something that I‚Äôve adjusted to and I now know that I just need to tighten it more than I think I need.
review.name: I really like it

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and lightweight harness! I can wear it for hours and honestly forget that it's on. I especially love the 2 more heavy duty gear loops in the front. I've used this harness climbing in the gym and outdoors, climbing both sandstone and limestone and the it's holds up really well, it's super durable. I definitely recommend it

name: Togir 3 Slide Harness - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for cheaper alternative to Part Tool's chain cleaner, and found this one. The picture showed 16 oz (473 ml), and the price was $8 which was almost twice as cheap as Part Tool's one. So I order two bottles thinking it would be 16 oz bottles. However, I received two 4 oz (120 ml) bottles which was unexpected.
Please fix the picture to avoid customers' confusion.
review.name: Misleading volume in the product picture
comment: Please select the correct dropdown next time. You have to go through multiple steps to checkout and had plenty of opportunities to check the volume you selected. Your rating of 3 stars has nothing to do with the actual product. I give you 1 star sir. Good day.

name: Pig Juice Chain Cleaner

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately after two years the sticky grip on the inside of the strap started coming off and got my helmet sticky. The strap was stored in case and only used about five time total. It ruined my helmet with grease stain even after I got the sticky mess off.
review.name: Strap doesn‚Äôt last

review.reviewBody:
Probably won't buy another pair.

The lenses seem to have a reflective film of some kind, I can see my eyes in certain light conditions.

I feel airflow leaking in from my temple areas (enough to make my eyes water when skiing at high speed), might be my old Vantage Helmet, or my face shape, or the googs just not fitting tight enough where the frame meets the strap.

Was really stoked on the purchase but less stoked after being used for 50 days.
review.name: Probably won't buy another pair.

review.reviewBody: I got the alpine green with the rose lenses, the color is gorgeous, having two lenses for sunny days and cloudy days is so convenient and changing them is quick and easy. Even though they‚Äôre magnetic I am not worried about them popping out since there‚Äôs a small clip helping hold them on but the magnets are also very strong. So far they‚Äôve been perfect for the winter season and I highly recommend them!!
review.name: Amazing!!

review.reviewBody: Very nice goggles. Fit well with Smith helmets. Lens clarity is great
review.name: Very nice goggles. Fit well

review.reviewBody: The Squad MAG goggles have been great so far. Changing out the lenses has been fairly easy. The goggles fit well and have been fog free.
review.name: The Squad MAG goggles have

review.reviewBody: These goggles provide excellent visibility, changing lenses is remarkably easy and they look great. Because even if you don‚Äôt want to admit it - if you look good, you ski good! It fits especially well with the Smith Vantage helmet
review.name: A must have

review.reviewBody: These fit great and the color definition is excellent. Highly recommended! Plus the custy service with Smith is best in the industry.
review.name: Can't go wrong with these

review.reviewBody: These goggles are sweet! Really high quality and fit really well!
review.name: These goggles are sweet! Really

review.reviewBody: A goggle so good I recommend it to everyone. Seamless fit with smith helmet, warm, never fogs. That‚Äôs about all I can ask for!
review.name: Best goggle

review.reviewBody:
Style is great, and fit is great! 

The only thing that I was taken back on, was the airflow I feel come into the goggles. This may be due to allowing circulation to limit fog. I don‚Äôt necessarily like feeling the airflow coming into my goggles, but I still very much like the goggles.
review.name: Style is great, and fit

name: Squad MAG Goggles

review.reviewBody:
I am unable to revise my previous negative review.  Hence this second review, following up to share the wonderful customer care I have received after notifying the company of my dissatisfaction with the insulation factor in this jacket.  

Please be advised that this parka is not suitable for extremely cold conditions on its own.  As the company explains, and of which I was completely unaware, this parka needs a lighter jacket under-layer in cold climates. It it roomy enough to comfortably accommodate under layers, which does indeed create a much warmer experience in extreme temperatures; a common occurrence where I live.  We routinely experience temperatures well below zero.
review.name: I LOVE everything about my new parka, especially with extra layers for additional warmth in extreme temperatures and conditions.

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket. Bought it for warmer ski days and even on cold days with a few layers underneath it kept me pretty warm. It‚Äôs long and covers my butt which I like when skiing and the collar is fleece lined so it‚Äôs nice and soft when you zip it up all the way over your chin. Cool design too! Love it.
review.name: Get it!

review.reviewBody: I purchased this coat to have more of a snowboarder look when I‚Äôm skiing. This coat delivers. It is long and loose at the waist, perfect for skiing. Great for warmer and dry ski days. I wouldn‚Äôt wear this if it is pouring or snowing.
review.name: Loose and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a new winter jacket that i could use for winter sports and this one hit the mark! It does run large, i bought a medium and it's pretty roomy. I'm 5'2" and it covers my butt quite well too.
review.name: Great winter coat

review.reviewBody: This Parka is perfect! First time wearing it, I was on a hike up a 4,000' mountain with single tempts and a stiff wind. I was completely cozy. No drafts up the bottom thanks to the added waist closure. With the hood and zipper up, my head was very protected. I have a small and there was enough room to wear a base layer and soft shell underneath. Love all the pockets, that are where they should be. It is also breathable which is a bonus when climbing up. Highly recommended!
review.name: Great Winter Gear

name: Firefall Insulated Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody:
My pair has a definite design flaw. The stocking foot are way too tight. They are near impossible to take off without getting another person to pull on them. I doubt they will last long the way I have to struggle to get them off. Do not buy! I have been wearing my old pair of Simms even though they have a leak. 
Rich Fernandez
review.name: Too tight. Do not buy.

review.reviewBody: Perfect fit.  Just spent 5 days on a fast flowing stream with very good results. Previous G3 guide pair was purchased in 2010 with hundreds of miles on them.  Stockings finally wearing out so sent them back for repair and will be used as " backup"
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: These are the best waders on the planet. Mine are the previous version introduced in 2018. They fit like no other wader and they perform like no other wader. I have never had a leak. I had them customised with a different bootie size for a modest additional charge. My advice is don‚Äôt sit down on anything with spikes and don‚Äôt march through any bushes with spikes. That seems like common sense to me. Superb waders. I anticipate writing an equally positive review of my waders in several years time. Worth every penny (I live and fish in Scotland) or cent.
review.name: Simply The Best

review.reviewBody: I am a fish biologist in Washington State and wear waders pretty much two thirds of the year conducting stream and river surveys. I have owned several pairs of Simms waders and love the durability, flexibility, and breathability of the G3's. They are surprisingly rugged and have held up bushwhacking through blackberries, salmonberries and devils club, which can shred lesser waders.
review.name: G3 Waders

review.reviewBody: Could not be more disappointed. It was not easy to afford these waders. But I told myself that they would last and the price would be worth it. After less than 10 trips out, mostly in a raft for that matter. My waders leaked all over me on a February day resulting in a ruined trip. Simms used to stand for quality. What happened?
review.name: So ??????

review.reviewBody: The G3's continue to get better and better. Super durable and comfortable too. Also, the performance of your waders, particularly the seams, are dependent on after care. ALWAYS hang dry, inside and out, away from UV exposure and these will last even the most rugged conditions.
review.name: Love your waders and they will love you

review.reviewBody: This is my 4th pair of small king G3 waders. The sizing has changed and they no longer fit as well. I'm unable to cinch the suspenders up enough to keep the crotch from hanging so low that it doesn't feel "short crotched." The suspenders can't be shortened enough because of the pad that slides along the suspenders.
review.name: Okay but doesn't fit as well as previous pairs

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôve owned three pair of G3‚Äôs over the course of the last 16 years. They are great waders. One thing I noticed on my new ones is they seem to trap air in them very bad until I step into the water. Making wearing them in truck on the way to river impossible.
review.name: Air tight

review.reviewBody: These waders fit perfect and are absolutely bombproof!  The fit is perfect!  Very comfortable and warm!
review.name: Simms G3

review.reviewBody: The fit and durability of the G3 are hands down the best I have owned. They are breathable and perfect for spending long days on the water no matter the conditions
review.name: The best wader I have ever worn

name: G3 Guide Stockingfoot Wader - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my black Denali jacket from Northface; in fact I lost some weight, had it in a Large, and reordered a full price medium jacket this year because I wanted it to fit my new slender body! I also love this Alpine Polartec 1/2 snap jacket--the medium sizing fit well (5'6" 150#), the materials are high quality and warm, and the look sporty! Its perfect for New England's chilly falls and blustery springs! I would consider getting another color in the fall!
review.name: Would Consider Another Color

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a lot of polartecs, but I'm happy I purchased this Alpine Polartec Snap Jacket. Its loftier than the ones I already have, and the snap placket is different. Sizing is right on- I ordered a size medium and it fits fine (5'6" 150#). This will be perfect for our cool springs in New England!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm and fancy! A bit loose (doesn't have slim fit). But overall, I love it

review.reviewBody: This hoodie is awesome keeps you super warm and doesn't let you overheat. Highly recommended
review.name: Super comfy and warm

review.reviewBody: If you want a sun hoodie for the summer, this is it. It keeps me cool and dries quickly. It doesn't boast the best SPF values but I didn't get sunburned underneath at all. Did several peaks last summer with it and it was more breathable than the REI Sahara and the black diamond alpenglow pro. The fabric isn't as soft as others out there, but not to the point of being uncomfortable. Others reviews have mentioned that it pills easily, but I haven't ran into that yet.
review.name: Super breathable Sun Hoodie

review.reviewBody: It gets extremely hot here in Hawaii and I have found this shirt is perfect for working outside on sunny days!
review.name: Perfect lightweight shirt

review.reviewBody: This shirt is a fantastic garment.  I wear it as an undershirt and the hood is great as it helps to keep my neck warm when not wearing it on my head and helps to keep my ears warm on more chilly days.
review.name: Great shirt for layering

review.reviewBody:
One of my go-to sun shirts - I probably have 2-3 of them at this point. This shirt is super breathable (I run really warm and this is the only sun shirt I can leave the sleeves down all the way without burning up). The thumb holes are a really nice addition, and lets me use it as a light baselayer in shoulder seasons.

Fit is true to size

Great for hiking. Lighter weight than your typical fishing sun hoodie. Used this sun hoodie for backpacking and canoeing in Minnesota. Great to block the sun. Doesn‚Äôt have a built in mask. The hood is better than a hat on the water, because a brim hat will muffle the sound around you. This shirt is for everyone.
review.name: Light weight Sun Hoodie

review.reviewBody: It feels really nice and breathable, plus it looks very good!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: The Echo Hoodie is a well-documented and recommended product for a reason. It fits well and true to size, is incredibly comfortable, and is perfect to add to a layering system or to wear on its own for fishing or mountaineering. If I could change one thing it would be the hood. It runs a little tight and doesn't fit great with a helmet. Overall a great buy that I will purchase again when this one wears out many years down the line.
review.name: Perfect Fit, Comfortable, and Versatile

review.reviewBody: Use this for all 4 seasons, I am a 6', 195lb male and it is the perfect all around layer.
review.name: Incredibly Versatile Layer, fits as expected

review.reviewBody: warm for how lightweight it is.  sleeve length is perfect and the hood fits good does not cover eyes or shift.  I own three now and use them often
review.name: lightweight hoodie

review.itemreviewed: PR 1400 Dicut Oxic Road Wheel - Tubeless
review.reviewBody:
Are you a climber ? Do you like light wheels ? Do you like a wheel set that is lively and reactive? These stiff, light alloy wheels spin up very quickly and that‚Äôs a definite plus but it‚Äôs not the only positive feature of this very high quality wheel set from DT Swiss. If you like fast descents on tight twisty roads, if you like getting out of the saddle and hitting the roll overs hard, if you like feeling your ride spring instantly into action when you put the power down these wheels are definitely worth a look.
I replaced a set of 45mm carbon hoops with these wheels and I never put them back on the bike.
Fast on climbs. Fast on descents. Fast and tight in corners. Fast in a sprint and this is a great looking set of wheels !
review.name: I love these wheels !

name: PR 1400 Dicut Oxic Road Wheel - Tubeless

review.reviewBody: Big enough to fit the stove, pot, pan and lid, unlike the bag that came with the stove.  Bought this for the cookset and will use the smaller bag that came with the genesis stove to carry my extra pot, bowls and cooking utensils.  Organizer me is very happy

review.reviewBody: These bags are not easy to find. So happy to have it
review.name: Perfect fit !

review.reviewBody:
I just received my jetfoil genesis base camp last week.  This was ordered without the pan and pot because I already have those items.  The bag that it comes in will only fit the complete set WITHOUT the regulator if you stress the zipper to its max!  So i figured that the whole system bag is different so I ordered it and just received it.  This bag i can't even get the zipper to close with the system in it with or without the regulator!!!!!!!!!

We have another complete genesis base camp and the bag that came with that you can fit the regulator, jetfoil utensils and a jet hose and still have room.  How do i get the correct bag for my second setup?????????????
review.name: Two of these that the system doesn't fit in!
comment: Thank you for reaching out and I am sorry to hear about the bad fit with your bag. Please give us a call at 1-800-572-8822 so we can make this  right.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag for use with the Half-Gen unit and associated frying pan along with 5 liter Cook pot. The bag fits well with a little room to spare. The original Half-Gen bag will not fit the 5 liter pot. I‚Äôll use it to stow my Mighty-Mo and 1.8 liter cup with Luna and French press accessory. I‚Äôm very pleased with my purchase.
review.name: Genesis System Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this to put my Jetboil stoves in it.  It is made so well that I can't wait to get the stove that it was actually made for.
review.name: Very well made.

review.reviewBody:
I have been wearing Knockaround glasses for over a decade now, and I just can't get away from them. I currently own several pairs, that I keep in all of my vehicles and boats. They are comfy, the polarization is great, and they hold up to abuse better than most glasses.

I have the black-on-black color in the Mai Tais, and they are super dark. Great for being out in direct sunlight. I've worn them hiking, fishing, rafting, and will continue to wear them daily!

review.reviewBody: Great modulation with lots of bite when you need it. Not one if the brakes that are either on or off. True mini-codes.

review.reviewBody: Indeed, felt solid, great trail brake. I really appreciated no "wiggle" play in the lever.  But, first season, had simple uphill wet root slip and the bike, with zero velocity, laid down.  And well, the brake lever snapped, right at the hanger where it attaches to the bars.  super simple and snaped straight in two.
review.name: G2 Brake Broke
comment: Not saying this is what happened here, but the screw hole represents a ?weak point? in some designs and if the clamp had been over-tightened a bit, this could be a setup for a fracture if the lever takes a hit.  Whatever the cause, better it happened when it did rather than a technical downhill section...
